title: Talent Assessment and Experience, Senior Consultant - HR Consulting
description:
At Mercer, we believe in building brighter futures. Together, we’re redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. We do this by understanding data and applying it with a human touch across a dynamic Health, Wealth and Career business portfolio. For 75 years, our employees have been turning ideas into action to build healthier and more sustainable futures for our clients, colleagues and communities and people.

To strengthen our growing business in Singapore, we are looking for talent to join our Talent Solutions business, as an Talent Assessment and Experience Senior Consultant - HR Consulting

Mercer Talent Solutions business: Mercer Singapore’s Talent Solutions business helps clients navigate the Future of Work. With the strongest Workforce Products & Insights database the market, we bring Reward and Talent expertise together to improve the way work works – from organization design, to strategic workforce... planning, to identifying future work, skills needed, skill-gaps, action plans for transformation, to performance and total rewards.

Talent Assessment and Experience Senior Consultant - HR COnsulting

Our Culture: Entrepreneurial, Data-hungry, Curious, Energetic and Ambitious

Skills we really care about: Problem-Solving, Creative Thinking, Collaboration, Adaptability

What can you expect ?
• Lead sales and client engagement in talent assessment, employee experience and engagement
• Provide thought leadership by developing points-of-view and opinion papers as well as research efforts relevant to those areas.
• Support client engagement and project delivery in other complementary areas, as needed

We will count on you to
• Develop assessment strategies, including value differentiators, go-to-market plans and channel management plans for Mercer’s solutions in the practice area
• Lead business development efforts including the generation of leads and engagement with prospects, build a strong and sustainable business development pipeline
• Lead proposal shaping, solution design fit to client needs and nurture upselling/ cross-selling client opportunities
• Lead, direct and guide consulting engagements by providing appropriate guidance to project teams to deliver client value
• Manage projects to time, quality, budget while building team skills
• Support team engagement and well-being, build a high performing team

What You Need To Have
• 8-10 years’ experience in HR consulting across various domains such as Talent Management, Assessment, Performance, OD
• Deep expertise in Talent Assessment, Psychometrics, building upskilling plans and project management
• Led small and large HR consulting and products sales

What Makes You Stand Out
• Thrive in problem-solving, shaping solutions, understanding and solving for client needs
• Drive a positive, constructive, engaging work and high-performance culture by espousing appropriate behaviors and inspiring others in the team to do likewise
• Take ownership in the career development needs and champion the professional development of consultants in the team
• Champion change management efforts for strengthening Mercer’s overall business and financial performance

About Mercer
Mercer builds brighter futures by redefining the world of work, reshaping retirement and investment outcomes, and unlocking real health and well-being. Mercer’s employees are based in 44 countries and the firm operates in over 130 countries. Mercer is a business of Marsh & McLennan (NYSE: MMC), the world’s leading professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people, with 75,000 colleagues and annualized revenue approaching $17 billion. Through its market-leading businesses including Marsh, Guy Carpenter and Oliver Wyman, Marsh & McLennan helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment. For more information, visit www.mercer.com. Follow Mercer on Twitter @Mercer

title: SAP Consultants (FIORI, MM, SD, ABAP, BRS)
description:
Are you the right person we are looking for as our team player to support our business growth? As part of our Next-Generation ICT Engagement and Consultancy (Thatz 2.0) growth roadmap, we are seeking keen candidates to join us on our journey as we scale towards greater heights.

Founded since 1998, Thatz International has now evolved into the Next-Generation ICT Engagement and Consultancy establishment.

Thatz 2.0 offers leading edge ICT & Digital Solutions, as well as, world class Services to organizations, companies or institutions seeking to further their operations or businesses excellence.

A BizSafe3 and TAFEP pledge company, Thatz International has been recognized through various achievements such as Singapore SME1000 since Year 2013 and Total Defense Award since Year 2012. The Founder has also been recognized with the inaugural Teochew Entrepreneur Award 2016.

Join Thatz now to maximize your true potential to the fullest by excelling in your CAREER!

ARE YOU THATZ ONE?

SAP... Consultants (FIORI, MM, SD, ABAP, BRS)

Primary Responsibilities:

A) SAP FIORI Consultant
• Responsible for technical and functional development and support of the SAP FIORI applications.
• Provide collaboration with SAP functional and business users to develop the FIORI screens and functions, participate in implementation projects and provide post Go-Live support.
• Propose UX solution, develop the FIORI screens and functions, perform requirement analysis and design, as well as document the technical design.
• Fix bugs.
• Perform testing and assist users in UAT.
• Perform cutover activities and provide post implementation support.

B) SAP MM Consultant
• Support Day to Day Incidents and Service Requests to Customers under SAP MM Modules and customization.
• Support Change Requests/Enhancements/Projects when it is required.
• Support any System Issues/Configurations/Customizations related with SAP MM Modules.
• Resolve issues and maintain system documentation.
• Deliver the solution/change within required timeline base on Service Level Agreement.
• Evaluate changes and solution proposal; adhere to the function of Template design.
• Communicate properly to Business and understand urgency and business impact of each issue.

C) SAP SD Consultant
• Implement SAP SD modules for SAP rollout and implementations, including conduct user requirements study, perform fit/gap analysis, design solutions, create blueprint and functional specifications.
• Configure and test systems, as well as perform data migration.
• Conduct User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and user training.
• Facilitate knowledge transfer from Project to Support team members.
• Resolve issues and maintain system documentation.
• Change request handling including feasibility study & solution design and functional specification & configuration.

D) SAP Consultant (ABAP and BRS)
• Planning, design, development, testing and release of custom objects.
• Develop technical architecture, strategy and guidelines documents.
• Provide Development Effort Estimates.
• Technical Specification and Unit Testing Document.
• Coding complex developments.
• Participate in project quality management tasks, such as peer and quality reviews of specifications, design documents, and code reviews.
• Responsible for analysing high-level business processes and requirements.
• Assist in testing to validate and provide operating controls to ensure development requirements are satisfied.
• Define and develop technical standard.

Job Requirements:

A) SAP FIORI Consultant
• Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or related disciplines and at least 5 years of JAVA/ABAP experience and at least 2 years of FIORI experience.
• Proficient in FIORI development such as standard Fiori 2.0 extension, customised Fiori, SAP UI5 and SAP OData.
• Proficient in ABAP development such as reports, adobe forms, Webdynpro programs, user exit, BADI.
• Good knowledge in Logistics management modules covering Project Systems, Contracts and Material Management of SAP.
• Strong analytical and trouble shooting skills.
• Good communication and inter-personal skills.
• Able to work independently and as a team.
• SAP Certified Application Associate or Professional will be preferred.
• Locals preferred.

B) SAP MM Consultant
• Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or related disciplines, must proficient in SAP MM Module with 5-10 years of experience in Support or Project Implementation.
• Good understanding of programming concepts and experience with structured design, development, and implementation of SAP.
• Experience with unit and integration testing
• Strong in business process (sales environment) & technical skills (configuration).
• Strong knowledge of info structure creation, configuration and updated rules.
• Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Good documentation skills using MS Office applications
• Able to communicate well at all levels.
• Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well on cross functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks.
• Locals preferred.

C) SAP SD Consultant
• Degree in Information Technology or Computer Science or related disciplines, with at least 5 years of experience in manufacturing industry, minimum 4-5 complete SAP SD implementations.
• Proficient in SAP Sales & Distribution (SD) and ECC 6.0.
• Strong in business processes & technical skills (SAP SD configuration).
• Strong knowledge of info structure creation, configuration, updated rules and Order-to-Cash processes in a sales and manufacturing environment.
• Experience in SAP integration with sub-system.
• Experience with software unit and integration testing.
• Able to deliver the project on time and successfully.
• Good understanding of programming concepts and experience with structured design, development, and implementation of new computing architectures.
• Good analytical and problem solving skills.
• Good documentation skills using MS Office applications
• Able to communicate well at all levels.
• Strong interpersonal skills; ability to work well on cross functional project teams and foster team commitment to tasks.
• Knowledge in WM / QM / Vistex system is preferable, but not mandatory.
• SAP certification in SD module will be advantageous.
• Locals preferred.

D) SAP Consultant (ABAP and BRS)
• At least 5+ years of experience in the SAP development is required.
• Proficient in ABAP, including Reporting, Interface, Conversion, Enhancement & Forms (RICEF).
• Have good technical business process of SAP SD, MM, PP & FI/CO modules.
• Experience in web-service development, OData & Fiori and S/4 HANA.
• Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
• Locals preferred.

Key objective of this role:

To deliver awesome user experience through result oriented yet friendly service disposition ...we call it Thatz Way!

As a people developer, we embrace Thatz Delight for:
• Annual Increment based on your job performance
• Company events and annual awards
• Community and sustainability support

As an advocate for fair employment, we strive to do our best to render objective and merit based considerations for all applications, and we shall communicate with you personally when short-listed. For those who are not short-listed, your profile will be kept for other opportunities where suitable.

Best wishes to your job search!

Feel free to recommend this position to your friend(s) or relative(s) who may meet our needs and be rewarded.

For more information about THATZ and other job listings, please visit: www.thatz.com

Please like our Facebook: www.facebook.com/thatz.international

LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/thatz-international-pte-ltd

Our Software Product: www.thatzcontact.com and https://yummydurian.com

title: Microsoft Azure Consultant
description:
Overall Purpose:

The Senior Solution Specialist Cloud Computing is end to end accountable to provide seamless Cloud computing services across all regions supporting Company’s operations and the digital transformation in a cost effective way.

The role is accountable for plan, build and run (third level support for operations) of enterprise computing solution for Cloud providing a technology strategy and roadmap, managing the solutions lifecycle, design and architecture of new solutions and provide third level support and problem solving to Operations team when requested. Also will be accountable for managing the technical cloud environment, orchestrating or partners, managing our cloud contract, knowledge map, inventory and capacity management.

The role is accountable for delivering projects and services to the entire enterprise with a level of budget responsibility and team member leadership, both direct and indirect.

Main accountabilities (Main Responsibilities):

· Delivery... projects aligned with the strategy and roadmap for Cloud computing services domain.

· Accountable to technically lead highly engaged teams of internal and external resources in different locations, cultures and countries, delivering the enterprise mission and vision and adhering to enterprise commitments/values

· End to end technical accountability for plan, build and run and the successful delivery of technology projects and services as measured through value, cost, quality (service levels) and schedule. This includes the full lifecycle of the solutions, projects and services, including strategy, planning, architecture, design, operations, maintenance and decommissioning

· Ensure compliance with and participate in continuous improvement of organizational standards, practices and methodologies

· Define, track, measure and report on critical success factors and key performance indicators

· Partner for success across the Information Technology ecosystem and with our business partners and our suppliers

· Efficiently plan and manage projects and services budgets, according to enterprise investments and strategies

· Deliver projects, platform or service analysis, design, and build on compute technologies for Cloud as necessary in a self-motivated manner and consistent with Engineering Release Plan and project deliverables

· Drive benchmarking exercises to ensure Company’s IT remains within the top tier of best practices

· Accountable for technical solutions that meet the needs of our business units in a cost-efficient manner

· Ensure security standards and policies are implemented

· Efficiently plan and manage projects and services capacity and demand by following the Information Technology and/or enterprise demand processes

· Ensure positive partner/customer experience through satisfaction surveys

· Proactively lead through organizational change and the evolutions needed in the IT Way/Competencies

· Implement best practices and continuous improvement programs

· Drives continuous financial performance improvement in Cloud Services Domain

· Lead communication on service performance

· Collaborate with enterprise stakeholders, providing advice and assistance to coordinate and operationalize the integrated strategic and operational plans for innovative technologies, methodologies and processes.

Knowledge and Experience:

Experience (including number of years):
• Experience within the trading and food industry (desired)
• Experience in a large, complex organization
• 5+ years of wide-ranging and deep experience IT and at least 5 in Cloud Technologies including but not limited to Microsoft Azure and Cloud Automation Tools.
• 5+ years of technical team leadership experience with increasing levels of accountability (desired)
• Proven experience in Architecture of new solutions in Cloud
• Proficiency in security (highly desired).
• Recognized record of accomplishment for completing complex cross-functional environments.
• Strong understanding of infrastructure convergences and business benefits provided (highly disered).
• Experience in solution architecture, program management, engineering, vendor management, project management and technical operations.
• Proven experience delivering technology projects and services, with excellent customer quality, cost and outcome measures
• Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication and presentation skills
• Ability to work with a range of technical staff, architect and operational and business partners to develop joint solutions
• Ability to facilitate problem solving among groups with varying needs and priorities
• Understanding of ITIL frameworks, Agile and lean principles
• Excellent analytical skills
• Ability to multi-task and prioritize work

Languages: Fluent English both written and spoken mandatory.

Other skills and competencies:

IT skills:

§ Knowledge of ITIL process

§ Knowledge in Agile Methodology (Scrum and Scale Agile Framework highly desired)

§ Experience in managing IT organization transformation projects across different regions and cultures

§ Demonstrated capacity to manage external partner in different countries

§ Cloud knowledge and Architecture skills (highly desired)

§ Automation or Orchestration experience (highly desired)

Business skills:

§ Ability to work with virtual teams (good phone and video conference call skills) in multi regions, culture and location

§ All work done in English (must have an excellent level both spoken and written)

§ Have excellent communication skills

§ Ability to deal with stakeholders at all levels (desired)

§ Business oriented (focus in value to the business)

Behavior skills:

§ Excellent customer facing/customer service skills

§ Demonstrated leadership and team-management skills in multi-cultural, regions environment

§ Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to communicate effectively at all levels (written and verbal)

§ Ability to work positively with a wide range of individuals

§ Ability to work in fast-paced, reactive, and challenging trading environments

§ Business oriented

§ Sense of ownership

§ Sense of urgency

§ Collaboration approach and solution driven mentality

§ Autonomy with responsibility

Certifications:

§ AZ-900 (Microsoft Azure Fundamentals)

§ (Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies) & (Microsoft Azure Architect Design)

Or

§ (Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies) & (Microsoft Azure Architect Design) Or

§ (Microsoft Azure Architect Technologies) & (Microsoft Azure Architect Design)

Or

title: Talent Acquisition Consultant [Internship]
description:
Job Description

Have you ever wondered what the hiring process for companies was like?

Are you open to networking and establishing connections between firms and talents in the legal industry?

Do you want to make an impact and change someone’s course of life?

Join us and discover more on the behind-the-scenes of a legal recruitment firm!

In this 3-month internship, together with a team of other recruiters, you are responsible for the end to end recruitment cycle process.

A hands-on experience and steep learning curve guaranteed!

What can you take away from us?
• How to source for the right talent using both traditional and creative recruiting methods and resources
• How to provide staffing solutions and manage talent pipeline to meet the needs of the business units
• A more comprehensive understanding of the legal industry
• Improved interpersonal and networking skills
• How to be resourceful and efficient as we manage, prioritize and close talent searches against a timeline
• A... real insight into, and personal experience with corporate life – life as a legal recruitment consultant

Responsibilities of a legal recruiter:

Recruitment
• To actively source for potential candidates for different legal placements via many channels
• Communicating with professionals in the legal industry who hold managerial roles and above

Administrative
• Posting of job advertisements
• Data entry and documentations
• Updating and maintenance of documents

Our Preferred Skills:
• Driven, resourceful and self-motivated
• Ability to work creatively and calmly under pressure
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• A detail-oriented, data-driven mentality
• A cheerful and positive mindset
• Well-versed in Microsoft Office

Requirements:
• Minimum ‘A’ Level Certification
• Minimum 3 months commitment

Join our team of highly passionate, driven and warm staff at Recruit Legal today!

Interested applicants may contact Claire at legal@searchasia.com.sg

title: Solution Consultant
description:
Â:TraceLink is seeking a full-time, experienced “Solution Consultant” to join our team. TraceLink has built the world's largest cloud-based network dedicated to protecting patients, ensuring compliance and growing profits across global life sciences. The TraceLink Life Sciences Cloud is our network, platform and community that links people, processes and information everywhere from ingredient to patient.
Businesses across the globe, including 16 of the top-20 pharmaceutical companies, trust us to help them manufacture and deliver safe, secure medicines to the patients who need them anywhere in the world. We need game changers ready to break down business barriers, master new technologies and become trusted advisors for some of the largest and fasting growing companies on the planet.

The Opportunity:

The Solution Consultant plays a critical role in mapping TraceLink’s solutions to our customer’s requirements and creating the business case for TraceLink’s solutions with our customers... This position is a highly visible within the organization and you will routinely interact with TraceLink Senior Management, Sales, Product Management, Engineering and Services organizations as well as with our prospects’ senior leadership.
Â:Responsibilities:
• Act as subject matter experts as it relates to TraceLink solutions
• Prepare sales presentations and product demonstrations for both technical, business and executive management audiences
• Prepare materials and lead Solution Workshops as part of the sales process
• Lead supply chain business process discovery sessions
• Develop Solution Maps and Blueprints as part of the TraceLink sales process
• Quantitatively model the benefits of TraceLink’s solutions
• Understand and deliver the value proposition of TraceLink’s solutions
• Respond to Customer Request for Proposals and Information (RFP/RFI)
Â:Qualifications:
• 5+ years’ of experience in related discipline (pre-sales consulting for Enterprise software, or Life Sciences supply chain position)
• Strong presentation and written communication skills to all levels
• Experience with supply chain business processes, such as contract manufacturing, third party logistics providers, and distribution operations.
• Experience with ERP and supply chain solutions such as SAP/ERP, SAP/WM, SAP OCR/All, WMS, Oracle/JD Edwards, JDA a plus
• Experience with systems integration technologies for data exchange
• Strong aptitude for explaining and applying advance technologies
• APICS CPIM, CSCP certification a plus
• Travel 30%-50

title: Regional Sustainability & Net Zero Lead Consultant
description:
Company Description

At Turner & Townsend we’re passionate about making the difference. That means delivering better outcomes for our clients, helping our people to realise their potential, and doing our part to create a prosperous society.

Every day we help our major global clients deliver ambitious and highly technical projects, in over 110 offices worldwide.

Job Description
• South East Asia
• Full-time
• Department: Advisory

This is an opportunity for real impact and career progression, joining a global professional services company and take a leading role in the South East Asia net-zero carbon transition.

We are a growing team of sustainability consultants that support Turner & Townsend clients across Asia and globally with their transition to low-carbon, sustainable future models. The size of Turner & Townsend offers opportunities to work across a range of projects across Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources/Renewables.

This role is focused on building our... sustainability capability in South East Asia, with potential to expand across Asia, working closely with Turner & Townsend’s multidisciplinary teams – from our regional hub in Singapore. We are seeking candidates who bring sustainability consultancy capabilities and networks and are excited by the opportunity to build a new team within this growing sector.

As part of our national Sustainability team, you will be supported by our team who run major existing commissions across the Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources Sector.

Overview of the role

The aim is both to develop a locally-relevant & present service to support Turner & Townsend’s business in region – as well as to support other global Sustainability initiatives as required.

The successful candidates are will need to be able to competently deliver Sustainability and Net Zero/Energy Efficiency consultancy advice as the basis for growing a team. For this you’ll need experience and understanding of some or all of the following subject matter:
• Regional and/or corporate decarbonisation programmes
• Energy efficiency and carbon emissions reductions for existing assets
• Low carbon & sustainable design & certification for new construction
• Strategy/project delivery experience in the built environment
• Programme and project management and leadership

Key outcomes

Working with regional strategic leadership and our existing local teams to develop and deliver a growing pipeline of sustainability consultancy in the region, responding to a significant level of interest from existing clients.

Approximately 50% of your time is expected to be spent delivering consultancy services, with the other 50% work winning and team development, with an aim to grow a team within 12 months.

Typical Consultancy Services

Turner & Townsend’s support for clients extends throughout the full consultancy life-cycle and whichever lifecycle stage may cover diagnostics, strategy, consulting, delivery management, assurance and continuous improvement. We operate across Real Estate, Infrastructure and Natural Resources/Renewables and support both the public and private sectors with their existing assets and new-build capital programmes.

Across the Sustainability Team, and within these growth roles, we wish to build-out our regional capability to support clients with:
• Net Zero programme management
• Net Zero baselining, strategy & action plans
• Energy efficiency & renewables
• Certification – BREEAM, LEED, WELL
• Social value
• Embodied carbon
• City-wide/Regional Energy Accelerator Programmes
• UK/Global client support programmes

Additional services that we would be interested in:
• Waste/circular economy
• Heat networks & smart energy
• Policy & research
• Digital solutions for management and reporting
• Sustainable procurement
• Training & leadership

Qualifications

Candidates should have strong experience and a good applied knowledge of sustainability, energy management and carbon reduction projects, covering a number of the consultancy areas outlined above.

Key background includes
• Public sector (including housing, local, regional and/or central government)
• Private sector (including developers and/or large corporates)
• Team building, management and leadership
• Consultancy and business growth

We have existing consultancy services that could be expanded in social housing, local government and health sector so experience would be particularly advantageous.

Competencies

Essential
• Firm professional grasp of the wider sustainability agenda
• Ability to lead this service regionally, supporting clients and colleagues to understand and maximise sustainability in projects and programmes
• Good understanding of low and zero carbon technologies and strategies to reduce emissions in buildings (e.g. Renewable energy, heat pumps and fabric measures)
• Effective relationship management
• Enthusiasm for growing a team and business in a fast moving environment

Desirable
• Ability to develop and convey strong business cases to support investment in carbon reduction and sustainability
• Structured approaches to environmental management (e.g. ISO14001/EMS/ISO50001)
• Experience in new build or retrofit of buildings (domestic or non-domestic)

#LI-RT1

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com

title: IT Technology Senior Consultant
description:
Requisition ID: 269580

Work Area: Information Technology

Expected Travel: 0 - 10%

Career Status: Professional

Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve... people’s lives.

SUMMARY

As a member of the Secure Workstation Services Team in Workplace Delivery, you and your fellow colleagues are responsible for delivering, managing and supporting the secure administrative workstation environment across all SAP environments. The team utilizes the latest Windows 10 operating system, Microsoft security toolsets and Microsoft Endpoint Management services to provide next level security for administrators accessing SAP's most critical infrastructure services. As a senior team member, you will be a subject matter expert in one or more topics (Windows OS hardening, supply logistics, Patching, deployment, etc) while supporting the day to day operations during the Asia Pacific time zone.

The ROLE:
• The position requires great analytical and communication skills in combination with a genuine service-oriented approach with the ability to anticipate changes and recommend service improvements
• Workplace Delivery provides the key services and infrastructure to support SAP's digital transformation globally. We are a diverse and global team focused on using the latest technology to deliver extraordinary results.

ROLE REQUIREMENT
• Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines or similar work experience
• Security + certification or equivalent
• Microsoft 365 Certified: Enterprise Administrator Expert or equivalent
• Minimum 5 years experience configuring and delivering Microsoft Windows devices to end users, with recent experience hardening the Windows 10 operating system
• Minimum 5 years experience deploying Microsoft Windows with System Center Configuration Manager or Microsoft Intune (Microsoft Endpoint Manager)
• Powershell, Advanced Level
• Microsoft Windows OS troubleshooting, Expert Level
• Previous experience working in a large organization supporting users across mulitple time zones and countries

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations

title: Investment Consultant
description:
Singapore

Sales

Global Wealth Management

Job Reference #
228122BR

City
Singapore

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Do you have the ability to provide holistic investment advice in Capital Markets? Do you have expertise across a range of asset classes and markets? Do you want to maximize the benefits of a global franchise for the good of clients? Do you have proven track record advising clients in advisory portfolios across bespoke instruments?

We are looking for Investment Consultants to:
• partner the Client Advisers to provide holistic and bespoke investment solutions on Capital Market products to priority clients
• collaborate with our Chief Investment Office (CIO) and other investment advisory teams to pitch UBS' entire investment and trading capabilities
• participate in client meetings in Singapore and on business trips regarding acquisition, review and retention of clients

Your Career Comeback
We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program... on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Your team
You will be working as part of Wealth Management APAC in Advisory & Sales as an Investment Consultant based in Singapore. The Investment Consultant team is responsible to activate our larger clients by bringing them timely asset class targeted solutions. This equates to a co-coverage model between a Client Adviser and an Investment Consultant. The Investment Consultant will support the Client Adviser to ensure that UBS’ entire investment and trading capabilities are systematically provided to these priority clients. We are a dynamic, open minded and active team that enjoys working to provide best in class solutions for our clients.

Your expertise
• at least 7 years of experience in sales, marketing or trading of Capital Markets services
• specialization in at least one asset class or product type, such as Equity, Fixed Income, Foreign Exchange, Structured Products, or Derivatives
• possess a strong drive, initiative, adaptable and be able to work independently in a stressful and demanding environment
• proven presentation skills in front of clients and Client Advisers, and strong understanding of the needs and sensitivities of clients (private individuals and families)
• sales and service oriented with excellent communication skills
• an advanced degree in the area of finance. CFA certification is a plus
• fluent in English and business Mandarin, while other languages are a plus to service the Greater China market.
This is a demanding role due to the complexity and high volume of the business. Perseverance, initiative and a strong drive are key attributes to be successful in the role

About us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce

Resolve data migration issues, resolve cut over user issues with speediness and coordinate among other team members for deployment activities in order to ensure a smooth go live to new processes or product or system for the customer.

At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

We are seeking exceptional, highly skilled individuals to join Japanese Client Services / Japan SEA Collaboration as full time Director.

Recognizing the strong momentum of investment by Japanese companies’ in ASEAN, our Consulting groups in Southeast Asia and Japan launched a collaboration in 2012 to provide a wide range of business consulting services for over 100 Japanese clients across the region, including some of the biggest manufacturing companies in the world.

In response to the expansion of Japanese businesses... in Southeast Asia, there have been numerous collaboration initiatives between Deloitte Southeast Asia and Japan since 2012. Now there are over 100 consultants of diverse nationalities across the ASEAN region focusing on Japanese clients. We also have a joint training program for new consultants, and through the engagements with multinationals and ASEAN companies, we are able to build their capabilities and experience and provide our people with meaningful experiences, and a unique career path.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

If you are someone with:
• The right person will be detailed, highly technical, having 6+ years of current network infrastructure experience, preferably with Cloud integration from on premises networks
• AWS Certified or Google Cloud Certified
• 2+ years project experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (GCP, Azure or AWS)
• 2+ years architecting, implementing and supporting Network for Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform
• Experience with infrastructure as code is a must
• Experience with building, configuring and supporting network infrastructure solutions (on-premises, virtualization, Public Cloud) using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures
• Technical proficiency including systems experience, strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, and issue management in a multi-platform environment
• Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools
• Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture is an advantage
• Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning
• An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.
• Proficiency in the Japanese language (Business Level) due to regional project requirements.

Next Steps

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

Recruit Legal is the leading specialist legal recruitment consultancy in Asia. The firm's proven search process and broad industry and regional expertise has enabled successful placements to be made in Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai and Jakarta. We have very quickly been recognized as one of the leading consultancies in the region, and we count top international law firms and global multinationals as our clients. Beginning as an informal unit in Recruit Express and formalized into an independent legal division in 2003, Recruit Legal has since 1996 provided legal recruitment services to a broad client base. Over the years, our consultants have gained considerable experience in the placement and procurement of mid-level and senior legal professionals. We continue to focus on the core legal markets in Asia-Pacific.

Our goal is to be recognized as the pre-eminent adviser providing a complete range of legal placement and procurement services to legal professionals and clients worldwide. Our focus is to facilitate the success of our business clients whilst enhancing the career opportunities of our candidates. We are committed to ensuring the 'right fit'. Our clients, which include multi-national corporations, international banks and leading international and local law firms, have benefited from our quality advice ranging from current market trends to mid-and high- level developments in the legal industry. We have offices in Singapore, Sydney, Kuala Lumpur and Taiwan, as well as partner network in Hong Kong, Shanghai and Japan. Our global reach ensures that we are poised to assist clients with a global reach, and candidates who wish to relocate overseas

title: Gastroenterologist - Public teaching hospital - Singapore! (BB-D713E)
description: This is an exciting opportunity to experience life in one of the world’s greatest cities! Singapore has a lot to offer including, having a healthcare system that is regarded as one of the best in the world, having a highly rated education system and also being South East Asia's travel hub, servicing flights to (well almost) anywhere! 600 bed teaching hospital with teaching opportunities available New and modern facility with state of the art facilities Excellent quality of life English speaking work environment Performance bonuses are available as well as annual salary increments Generous salary package Relocation assistance offered to foreign nationals Foodie's paradise Access to one of the world's most efficient transport systems A very low tax rate or 12.5-15% – that means more income left over for you to spend! Please note that your day to day work plan will be discussed directly with the Head of the department, during the interview process but please feel free to call me to find... out more about the hospital and opportunity. The main criteria for this post is to find a candidate who is experienced and comfortable in EUS and ERCP. Singapore’s population is highly diverse; with a patient flow of Chinese, Malay, Indian and westerners as regular clientele, cultural appreciation is required. What are we looking for? The hospital is ideally looking for a specialist with one or more of the below: Certification by one of the medical specialty boards of the American Board of Medical Specialties (ABMS) Specialist Certification by the Royal College of Physicians and Surgeons of Canada Fellowship with the Hong Kong Academy or College (FHKAM, FHKAM etc) Certificate of Completion of Training (CCT or CCST) awarded by a competent authority of the UK or Ireland Certification by one of the Royal Colleges in Australia Please note that the career path for a specialist in Singapore follows Associate consultant, Consultant and Senior consultant. We are supporting with hiring of specialists consultant and Senior consultant level for this department. What does Singapore have to offer? Singapore is a bustling cosmopolitan city populated with high-rise buildings and landscape gardens. Brimming with a harmonious blend of culture, cuisine, arts and architecture, Singapore is a dynamic city that’s rich in contrast and colour that embodies the finest of both East and West. There are numerous shopping malls, museums, and dining and entertainment hotspots to choose from. Alternatively, you could choose to discover Singapore’s old world charm. You can explore and experience the island’s key historical landmarks or memorials or you could embark on a heritage trail and enjoy the sights and sounds at various cultural precincts, notably Chinatown, Little India and Kampong Glam. What can Head Medical do for you? Arranging a position overseas is very exciting, but we understand that it can also be daunting and time consuming. We’re the UK's specialist in international medical recruitment and we‘ve helped many doctors relocate since we first started out in 2008 (you can read what people have said about working with us on our testimonials page). We know it’s important to balance career opportunities with lifestyle and we’ll talk through your plans and will get to know you to make sure we find the right role in the right location.Once we have secured a job for you, we’ll manage the Medical Registration and Visa application process, and support you (and your family) with the relocation itself

Recruit Legal is the leading specialist legal recruitment consultancy in Asia. The firm's proven search process and broad industry and regional expertise has enabled successful placements to be made in Singapore, Hong Kong, Beijing, Shanghai and Jakarta. We have very quickly been recognized as one of the leading consultancies in the region, and we count top international law firms and global multinationals as our clients. Beginning as an informal unit in Recruit Express and formalized into an independent legal division in 2003, Recruit Legal has since 1996 provided legal recruitment services to a broad client base. Over the years, our consultants have gained considerable experience in the placement and procurement of mid-level and senior legal professionals. We continue to focus on the core legal markets in Asia-Pacific.

Our goal is to be recognized as the pre-eminent adviser providing a complete range of legal placement and procurement services to legal professionals and clients worldwide. Our focus is to facilitate the success of our business clients whilst enhancing the career opportunities of our candidates. We are committed to ensuring the 'right fit'. Our clients, which include multi-national corporations, international banks and leading international and local law firms, have benefited from our quality advice ranging from current market trends to mid-and high- level developments in the legal industry. We have offices in Singapore, Sydney, Kuala Lumpur and Taiwan, as well as partner network in Hong Kong, Shanghai and Japan. Our global reach ensures that we are poised to assist clients with a global reach, and candidates who wish to relocate overseas

title: Senior Consultant - Cloud Engineering - SG1
via: via Jobs At Deloitte Southeast Asia - Deloitte
description:
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do

Cloud is transforming the way technology enables the business. It represents a radical shift in how IT services are obtained, used, and managed. Companies are navigating through the various cloud options and deciding between private, public, or a combination across different and dynamic provider ecosystems. Our cloud specialists guide our clients through multi-year journeys from the case for change through implementation across all dimensions of cloud - business alignment, technology architecture and design, cloud... application on-boarding, and transforming their operating model – to help solve our client’s most complex issues with the focus on value creation.

Our practitioners work collaboratively within integrated, cross-functional teams to deliver comprehensive strategies that enable Cloud and Infrastructure transformations. Teamwork is crucial as teams are composed of a diverse group of specialists across multiple disciplines from both within our consulting practice and from our clients, helping drive towards a successful outcome. Our practitioners are expected to own and deliver their respective deliverables while managing different clients and other stakeholders.

In partnership with other leaders in the firm, you will focus on selling and delivering cloud solutions using AWS. As Cloud Architect, you will you will drive the design and delivery of world-class cloud solutions for our clients, providing expertise on cloud infrastructure services including design, build and migrate. This includes taking a lead role in the cloud architecture and engineering practice. You will be challenged to find approaches that enable rapid adoption of new cloud services and drive transformation for our client’s business and IT processes.

• Promote public cloud internally to sales and delivery teams to drive growth.

• Be the go to person for Cloud Network engineering. You should have a deep understanding and hands on experience of services offered on Public Cloud platforms and understand how to configure these services to support the building of complex solutions.

• Support the solution architects, and delivery teams in design, build, configuration, testing and deployment on Public Cloud

• Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the Public Cloud solutions architect community

• Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates, and provide advisory around integration of on-premises environments with Public Cloud

• Act as a technical liaison between customers, delivery teams and support.

Enough about us, let's talk about you

If you are someone with:

• The right person will be detailed, highly technical, having 6+ years of current network infrastructure experience, preferably with Cloud integration from on premises networks

• Relevant certification in AWS, Google or Azure is preferred

• Professional certifications in Network would be advantageous

• 5+ years project experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (GCP, Azure or AWS)

• 5+ years architecting, implementing and supporting Network for Microsoft Azure or Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform

• Experience with infrastructure as code is a must

• Experience with building, configuring and supporting network infrastructure solutions (on-premises, virtualization, Public Cloud) using both Linux/Unix and Windows with specific recommendations on server, load balancing, HA/DR, & storage architectures

• Technical proficiency including systems experience, strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills, and issue management in a multi-platform environment

• Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools

• Experience with Enterprise application and database architecture is an advantage

• Demonstrated skills in communication (oral, written, presentation), analysis, problem solving and short term and long term planning

• An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad) is a pre-requisite to fit to our short-term and long-term project assignment.

Next Steps

So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified

description:
NCS is a leading information and communications technology (ICT) and communications engineering services provider across the Asia-Pacific region. We are headquartered in Singapore and a wholly owned subsidiary of the Singtel Group. We have in-depth domain knowledge and unique capabilities that create business value for customers. We offer a broad range of services, including consulting, systems development and integration, business process outsourcing, infrastructure management and solutions, and technology solutions.

As a Consultant, EUC & Service Desk, the broad area of your job responsibilities will cover the following:
• Create, test, and manage software packages for client software and applications
• Able to do scripting to package software or applications that cannot be done through standard formats
• Ensure the software package includes software configurations as defined by the customer
• Ensure package delivered is able to automatically detect missing software or system files... required for normal operations and able to automatically trigger recovery of the required files to ensure no further disruptions to the end users
• Ensure software package is deployable via the SCCM infrastructure
• Familiar with packaging tools such as, but not limited to Admin Studio
• Develop and document the packaging standards, naming standards, software packaging lifecycle management, testing methodologies and processes, and test plans for software packaging for approval by the customers
• Manage the customers’ requirement and seek customers’ approval for all software packages deployment, creates and updates work instructions
• Document standards and procedures
• Able to administer and support day to day Mcafee operations, including AV, harddisk encryption and anti-spyware.
• Build and automate reports for agent health, scan results, etc
• Provide incident response and reports as and when required
• Develop, prepare and maintain processes and documentation and reports on a periodic basis or as and when required

Ideal candidate should possess the following:
• Diploma / Degree in equivalent discipline
• Having 3 - 4 Years of experience of Software Packaging experience using AdminStudio, InstallShield, or equivalent
• Relevant experience in SCCM infrastructure, deployment of Software packages and scripting
• Proficient in as SCCM architecture, Mcafee endpoint security and deployment applications
• Good to have ITIL certification

title: SAP Consultant, Contract Management (BB-DC979)
company_name: ROCHE DIAGNOSTICS ASIA PACIFIC PTE LTD
description: Roles & ResponsibilitiesThe positionYou are responsible to support global and regional business operations by designing and implementing high performing, high quality global and regional ERP solutions in a timely manner, which allows business to drive processes effectively and efficiently from end-to-end. You provide consulting and support services in the area of SAP Contract Lifecycle Management, with focus on but not limited to: Contract and Instrument Lifecycle Management, Sales and Distribution, Integration of a Configure-Price-Quote (CPQ) solution into SAP ERP, Service Management related to the Contract Lifecycle Management domain, Workflows and API integration. You also work closely with the global and the Asia Pacific user community with the aim to optimize business processes and solutions. You are responsible to ensure delivery of proposed solutions; support for development of business possibilities; contribute to high productivity and motivation of working team with the use... of communication skills and cooperation. You standardize, harmonizes and innovate to simplify business process (e.g. using SAP MDM, Workflow, UI5, Fiori, etc.). You define and develop programs and interfaces using BAPI, IDOC, BDC, Smart Forms or SAP Script, user exits, screens/Reports/Interfaces. You work in a global team with colleagues being located in North America and Europe. This role will be reporting into the Head of SAP Commercial Contract Management in Mannheim, and will base in Singapore, regional office for Asia Pacific. Who you are Youare someone who influences your own development, pursues your interests across functions and geographies, and understands that a job title is not the final definition of who you are, but a starting point. You should ideally possess a Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, IT or equivalent with 4 or more years of experience in SAP SD. Ideally, you also have a certification in SAP SD. You have technical skills in all areas of ABAP workbench (including ABAP OO for complex custom build solutions). Certification in PMP, SCRUM, S/4 HANA is a plus. You have hands-on experience using integration with non-SAP systems via webservices / OData / ALE / IDOC / RFC / EAI / API / middleware. You have a track-record of delivering business change and process improvement initiatives using SAP solutions. You have the experience in organizing and facilitating meetings with business stakeholders to understand their needs and the business processes; have presented solutions to both technical and non-technical users; have conducted trainings / knowledge sharing sessions with business stakeholders. In addition, you have strong project management skills in managing mid-size projects and budget. You have the ability to resolve incidents or change requests independently as per SLA. You ensure high quality of solutions provided, as indicated for example in documentations. You should have the ability to manage ambiguity while coping with challenging business needs and project goals. With excellent communication and presentation skills, you must be able to communicate fluently in both written and spoken English. You should be able to work flexibly outside of normal working hours or on call arrangements to provide support as well as to be able to travel occasionally.Tell employers what skills you haveBusiness OperationsConsultingIntegrationProject ManagementRESTful WebServicesSAPSAP HANAService ManagementStakeholder ManagementERP systemLifecycle management

title: Senior Industrial Hygiene Consultant
description:
Senior Industrial Hygiene Consultant
- (21000029)

At Golder, we thrive on challenges.

Golder is not just a place to work, it is a promise of a living, dynamic environment where people collaborate, innovate, build enduring relationships, excel, and grow professionally in a strong culture of ownership.

A rewarding opportunity has arisen for an Senior Industrial Hygiene Consultant to join our Environmental Team based in Singapore to help deliver multidisciplinary project for an array of local and international clients.

Key duties and responsibilities include:
• Manage projects that involve the collection of workplace environmental and exposure data relating to ventilation, air, and noise, asbestos, mold, bio-hazards, and chemicals, among others
• Analysis of workplace environmental and exposure data to identify potential health and safety risks and recommend corrective action plans
• Conduct EHS and IH audits
• Client relationship management
• Business development and marketing
•... Preparation of high-quality deliverables including proposals and reports
• Coordinate contract and project management, including management of suppliers and sub-contractors
• Mentor junior staff

Skills, Qualifications, and Experience
• Tertiary qualification in Environmental Science / Engineering, Chemistry / Chemical Engineering, or related fields with at least 10 years of relevant professional experience
• Certified Industrial Hygienist
• Certified Asbestos management and surveyor
• Scientific expertise in the management of environmental and occupational hazards
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Keen attention to detail
• Effective written and spoken communication and interpersonal skills (i.e., English and another language)
• Proven knowledge of local workplace health and safety regulations
• Ability to engage with clients directly
• Ability to integrate into projects built with a team of professionals
• Strong organizational skills and proactive attitude
Your benefits at Golder will include:
• Competitive benefits and remuneration packages
• Deepen your expertise in a dynamic work environment
• Innovative and collaborative multidisciplinary projects
• On the job training, mentoring and coaching
• Global projects and travel opportunities

Renowned for technical excellence, Golder is a leading, global employee-owned engineering and consulting firm with over a half century of successful service to its clients. With over 165 offices worldwide, Golder’s 6,500+ professionals are driven by a passion to deliver results, offering unique specialized skills to address the ever-evolving challenges that earth, environment and energy present to clients across the infrastructure, mining, oil and gas, manufacturing and power sectors.

At Golder, we care about our people – we operate with integrity and embrace diversity. Our ownership structure affords us the opportunity to invest in our careers and take pride in something we truly own.

All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply for this role.

Please note: Golder does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies.

title: Senior Risk & Safety Consultant
description:
Location: Midlands/ South, Greater London, GB

An award-winning employer, our people are trusted and responsible, believing in what they do with a clear commitment to contribute to transforming the world we live in and shaping a world of trust. Bureau Veritas operates in a wide range of sectors, delivering Testing, Inspection and Certification services to some of the world’s biggest household names. With more than 400,000 global clients and a reputation for quality, we are at the forefront of service and innovation.

Our people are at the heart of everything we do, which is why we have worked hard to create a supportive and engaging working environment, which is open and inclusive and individuals are given the opportunity to fulfil their potential and really leave their mark.

Senior Risk & Safety Consultant

We are looking for a Senior Consultant to join our specialist Risk & Safety team. This role will lead on a range of risk, and health and safety projects to agreed quality, costs... and timescales.

Projects will include the design and implementation of complex H&S Management Systems, Inspections, Auditing, DSEAR service delivery and leading and providing support on other Risk & Safety Projects when required. Our client portfolio will provide you with a real diversity of exposure to different industries and the opportunity to really influence and set H&S standards for global, household names.

Make an impact doing work you can be proud of at Bureau Veritas. Contribute to a global mission to enhance standards with integrity and help us create a brighter future for our next generations, and a safer society for us all.

Responsibilities include:

Provide high quality technical consultancy to clients Keep abreast of current legislation, relevant national and international standards and guidelines and technical developments within the relevant field To respond to requests for client work and proposals Be exemplar in client management and relationship building Contribute to delivery of projects on time and to budget; to manage resources in the delivery of the projects; to undertake regular project reviews To follow all financial procedures in the delivery of projects Ensure the use of the Consulting Group technical tools and methodologies in delivery of projects to the standard set Support compliance with BVS QHSE and external quality/certification requirements Contribute to a rolling forecast to provide visibility of future workload Monitor individual utilisation versus targets and actively manage optimal utilisation Delivery against Key personal and divisional KPIs Support junior members of staff in delivery of consultancy services and ensure their compliance with site safety practices where site work is undertaken To support team working Ensure full implementation and use of the competency framework Support as required in the definition of the current and future market, market drivers and service offerings of the Consulting Group Marketing the relevant services of the company

Candidate requirements include:

Level 6 health and safety qualification, such as the NEBOSH Diploma Experience interpreting and implementing complex safety management systems either on a global scale, or in medium/ high risk industries Significant experience in a H&S role operating under an established Health and Safety Management System Liaison with a broad range of stakeholders at all levels of an organisation Extensive knowledge of UK H&S regulations and experience in practical implementation Strong analytical and report writing skills Positive approach to the challenges of change and see change as an opportunity Ability to prioritise and schedule objectives to optimise time, cost and quality Strives to improve performance and uses innovative methods to get there

Only Bureau Veritas can offer:

Structured development programmes, from apprentice to chartered engineer, to help you fulfil your potential, including face to face and e-learning programmes The opportunity to deliver excellence for high profile clients, including some of the world’s most recognised brands A long list of awards recognition including Top Employer nine years in a row and continued success in the RoSPA Occupational Health and Safety Awards

Plus:

Comprehensive financial package including competitive salary and allowances, defined contribution pension, 25 days holiday plus Bank Holidays, various insurances including Private Health Insurance and other flexible benefits to suit individual requirements

Please be aware that all roles within Bureau Veritas UK&I may require a DBS, Credit or Security Clearance Check.

Bureau Veritas is an equal opportunity employer. No job applicant or employee shall receive less favourable treatment because of their gender, marital or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, colour, race, ethnic origin, religion, disability or age.

Bureau Veritas operates a strict Code of Ethics that ensures the proper conduct of our day-to-day business

title: Technical Pre-Sales Consultant
description:
Technical Pre-sales Consultant provides technical support to various clients by applying their broad understanding of web/mobile technologies and SaaS platforms to solve real-world business problems. Pre-sales consultants are expected to work with various team members to a business case and develop a technical blueprint for solving and demonstrating product solutions to clients.

He/She must demonstrate strong communication skills, as they will work closely with executives, colleagues, and clients on a number of projects. This is a full-time position that takes place in an agile working environment and may involve travelling.

title: Systems Engineer / Senior Consultant (Digital Forensics and Incident response), National Cyber Incident Response Centre, CSA
company_name: MCI – Cyber Security Agency of Singapore
description:
ABOUT CSA

Established on 1 April 2015, the Cyber Security Agency of Singapore (CSA) provides dedicated and centralised oversight of Singapore's national cybersecurity functions. It is the national body overseeing cybersecurity strategy, operation, education and outreach and ecosystem development. It is part of the Prime Minister's Office and is managed by the Ministry of Communications and Information.

Responsibilities:

The key responsibility of an engineer in the Digital Forensics and Incident Response team is to facilitate an orderly and efficient response to cyber incidents. You are required to conduct forensics analysis on endpoints and network logs to support the investigations. Your responsibilities may also include managing the forensics lab and its supporting infrastructure. In addition, you will also be required to identify new technologies to enhance forensics analysis. Candidates with more than 5 years of relevant experience may be considered for the Senior Consultant... role.

Requirements:

Relevant qualifications preferably in Information Technology, Computer Security, Computer Science, or any other relevant fields; Good understanding of operating systems such as Windows and Linux; Able to perform forensics analysis across Windows, Mac and Linux Platform; Ability to analyze network and application logs; A team player with strong written and communication skills; Professional certifications such as EnCase Certified Examiner, AccessData Certified Examiner, SANS GIAC Certified Forensic Examiner (GCFE), GIAC Certified Forensic Analyst (GCFA), or GIAC Network Forensic Analyst (GNFA) would be advantageous

All applicants will be notified on whether they are shortlisted or not within 4 weeks of the closing date of this job posting

title: Education Consultant
description: Management Development Institute of Singapore Central Posted on 7-Apr-21 Education Consultant Management Development Institute of Singapore Job DescriptionResponsibilities: Develop new avenues of business with existing & new clients / business partners Conduct market research and organise marketing activities and campaigns in the region Monitor the effectiveness of the marketing campaigns Follow-up on leads, course applications, enrolments and payments via phone, email and social media platforms Work alongside with the Management to achieve individual and overall team enrolment targets Participate in overseas roadshows, career fairs / exhibitions and workshops Work with team to achieve student progression numbers and revenue targets for overseas students Requirements: Degree in Sales & Marketing / Business Administration or its equivalent Minimum 1 year of relevant working experience Good communication and interpersonal skills Familiar with social media platforms and competent in... Microsoft Office Excellent written and verbal communication skills in native language would be an advantage (in order to build and maintain good relationship with existing & new foreign speaking clients / business partners.) Highly adaptable to a fast-paced and dynamic environment Candidates who are sales and result-driven Please apply with a comprehensive resume including a summary of your working experience, current and expected salaries to us by clicking on "Apply Now" button below. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Additional Information Junior Executive Qualification Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree, Master's Degree Founded in 1956, the Management Development Institute of Singapore (MDIS) is Singapore’s oldest not-for-profit professional institute for lifelong learning. MDIS has two main subsidiaries: Management Development Institute of Singapore Pte Ltd which oversees its Singapore academic operations, and MDIS International Pte Ltd which focuses on MDIS’ globalisation strategy. MDIS offers internationally-accredited courses in Business and Management, Engineering, Fashion and Design, Health and Nursing, Information Technology, Life Sciences, Mass Communications, Psychology, Travel, Tourism and Hospitality Management, and Safety and Environmental Management. These programmes are offered in collaboration with renowned universities in the United Kingdom and the United States of America. MDIS is EduTrust certified, attesting to its exemplary education and business excellence standards. The institute was first awarded the certification in 2010 – subsequently renewed for four years in 2014 and 2018. MDIS was also one of the first Private Education Institutions (PEIs) to be registered under the Enhanced Registration Framework. The institute achieved a double win at the Singapore Prestige Brand Award (SPBA); it was one of four winners as well as the overall winner of the SPBA - Heritage Brands 2018. In 2017, MDIS was ranked 4th for the Enterprise 50 Award for its contributions in spurring Singapore’s economy. Continuing with its long-standing tradition of giving back to society, the MDIS Education Trust Fund (inaugurated in 1999) supports deserving students facing financial difficulties in pursuing their education in Singapore. To date, MDIS has awarded close to 8,000 scholarships and bursaries totalling nearly S$6 million. The institute also actively supports several charities and provides community assistance, in reaching out to the young, elderly, and disabled. Equally vested in corporate-level training, MDIS’ corporate training arm, the Management Development and Consultancy, was set up in 1995 to cater to the training needs of the workforce. In 2014, MDIS acquired the Service Quality Centre to diversify its offerings in training solutions – in its endeavour to be a premium provider of training solutions in the region. Apart from the main Singapore campus, MDIS has international campuses in Tashkent, Uzbekistan, as well as in Johor, Malaysia. MDIS also has representative offices in China, India, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, and Thailand, as well as agents throughout Southeast Asia. title: Senior Consultant, IT Security (Engineering)
description:
Trustwave helps businesses fight cybercrime, protect data and reduce security risks. With cloud and managed security services, integrated technologies and a team of security experts, ethical hackers and researchers, Trustwave enables businesses to transform the way they manage their information security and compliance programs while safely embracing business imperatives including big data, BYOD and social media. More than two million businesses are enrolled in the Trustwave TrustKeeper® cloud platform, through which Trustwave delivers automated, efficient and cost-effective data protection, risk management and threat intelligence. Trustwave is a privately held company, headquartered in Chicago, with customers in 96 countries. For more information about Trustwave, visit www.trustwave.com.

Role Responsibilities:
• Point of contact to assist and advise client for any ICT security related
• Lead and support customer in the matter of security incident response and resolution
• Team player... with good leadership qualities
• Customer-focused with good interpersonal skills
• Manage, configure and upgrade a wide variety of security technologies (e.g. FW, UTM, IDS/IPS, SWG/SEG, VPN, EPP, DLP, ATP, 2FA, PAM, etc.)
• Respond managed security technologies fault alerts and/or customer escalation
• Use strong fundamental knowledge (e.g. TCP/IP) and product-specific knowledge to perform troubleshooting on common technical issues on the managed security technologies

• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills and a passion for information security
• Fluent communicator in both written and spoken English; Good interpersonal skills

Technical Skills & Expertise:

• Tripwire Enterprise
